content.rendered:
Usage of talc

Applications

Talc is used as a filler, coating, pigment, dusting agent and extender in plastics, ceramics, paint, paper, cosmetics, roofing, rubber and many other products.

Pharmaceutical

As inert excipient it diminishes supports to nullify the chemical reactions between the compounds.

  • As inert excepient it diminishes supports to nullify the chemical reactions between the compounds.
  • As static carrier for medicated powders and pressed tablets.

Agriculture

In agriculture industry, as a flow agent it enables the free flow of the features and also stops the lump formation in the products.

  • As Anti caking agent obstructing the formation of Crystal Bridge.
  • As Die lubricant it makes the product.
  • As Flow agent offers free flow features.

Paper Industries

Talc improves the opacity, brightness, and whiteness also improve the paper’s ability to absorb ink .

  • Lessens the problem of core burst and crepe wrinkles.
  • Efficient ink transfers that result in improved quality of image.
  • Water repugnant and barrier property makes them the best ingredient to be used for barrier coatings.

Food Industries

Talc is used in the food industry to protect the food and ensure its quality. Talc is also added to the animal food which helps to prevent the loss of moisture from the animal feed. This ensures that the nutrients of the food is intact.

  • Is suitable for protecting food and ensuring the quality consistency.
  • Unique properties makes it distinctive which include the hydrophobic nature, the soft surface, organophilic and the chemically inertness.

Rubber Industries

  • Partitioning Agent, it allows in reducing friction and also acting as a preventive safeguard.
  • Lamellar components produce impermeable barrier and along with that it minimize liquid and air permeation Mechanical properties.
  • Industrial and mechanical goods, the basic characteristics include tensile strength, elongation and 100 % eco friendly towards environment.

Paint Industries

The platy shape of talc particles improves the suspension of solids in the can and helps the liquid paint adhere to a wall without sagging

  • It enhances the corrosion resistance and barrier properties.
  • Absorbing essential characteristics’, talc becomes the best for reduction in VOC content.
  • Enhances hiding powers and produces affordable extenders.

Plastic Industries

You can use these sections to highlight the features of heading. Use these paragraphs to focus on the topic you want. Make sure you keep it short and attractive.

  • Barrier effects for to prevent moisture and water.
  • Dimensional stability for better appearance and quality richness.
  • Application in WPCs and electronics gives better attributes to the product.

Ceramics Industries

Talc is used in large quantity by the ceramics industry because talc provides better optical and mechanical characteristics of sanitary ware glazes. It acts as a fluxing agent

  • As fluxing agent it reduces both energy costs and CO2 emissions.
  • Provides better optical and mechanical characteristics of sanitary ware glazes.
  • The mechanical property boosts modulas rupture as well as perspective stableness in its every application.

Soap & Cosmetics Industries

The use of talc adds lamellarity and purity. When talc is used in body, it acts as a perfume and in soaps, it acts as a filler. 

  • For soaps and syndets the chemical inertness results in high quality.
  • It assists in fragrance carrier for optimized quality results.
